Pre-Game Insights: The 76ers are on a two-game losing streak, while the Nets are coming off a tough win against the Milwaukee Bucks.
Philadelphia is in 'win-now' mode after acquiring Paul George, but their goal remains distant despite recent improvements.
The Nets are in rebuilding mode, recently trading Dennis Schroder and Dorian Finney-Smith for assets.
In the last 10 games, as Joel Embiid, Paul George, and Tyrese Maxey have seen more time together, the 76ers have posted a top-10 offensive rating, though their defense remains in the bottom 10.
The Nets have one of the league's worst defenses, and though they've fought hard, their primary aim is to secure a high draft pick.
Cam Johnson scored 26 points in the win against the Bucks but sustained an injury.
Others: For the 76ers, Kelly Oubre is questionable due to a hand injury, while Joel Embiid is also questionable because of a foot injury. Jared McCain and Kenyon Martin are both out due to a meniscus issue and a foot injury, respectively.

For the Nets, De'Anthony Melton is out for the season with an ACL injury. Ben Simmons and Cameron Johnson are both questionable due to back and ankle injuries, respectively. Maxwell Lewis, Bojan Bogdanovic, and Trendon Watford are out. Cam Thomas and Noah Clowney are also questionable due to hamstring and back injuries.
Predicted starting lineups for the 76ers: G - Tyrese Maxey, G - Kyle Lowry, F - Paul George, F - Caleb Martin, C - Joel Embiid.
Predicted starting lineups for the Nets: G - D’Angelo Russell, G - Cam Thomas, F - Keon Johnson, F - Jalen Wilson, C - Nic Claxton.
Cam Thomas to score under 23.5 points is -115 on DraftKings. Expect him to go under.
D'Angelo Russell to score over 15.5 points is -110 on DraftKings. Expect him to exceed this mark.
The 76ers are expected to break their losing streak tonight. The game should be a great opportunity for the team’s big three to shine and secure a victory.
